2023-11-03.name: Midwest Music Fest
2023-11-03.summary: Dozens of musical groups in all genres play in museums, galleries, cafes and arts centers across town. There are arts workshops for children, too.

2023-11-03.name: Driftless Film Festival
2023-11-03.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2023-11-04.name: Midwest Music Fest
2023-11-04.summary: Dozens of musical groups in all genres play in museums, galleries, cafes and arts centers across town. There are arts workshops for children, too.

2023-11-04.name: Driftless Film Festival
2023-11-04.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2023-11-04.name: Veterans Day Parade
2023-11-04.summary: It's at 11 a.m., starting on Wisconsin Avenue, crossing the river and heading north on Water Street. After the parade, there's a festival at the Marcus Center, with music, entertainment and a veteran-owned market.

2023-11-01.name: Driftless Film Festival
2023-11-01.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2023-11-02.name: Driftless Film Festival
2023-11-02.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2023-11-10.name: Art Attack
2023-11-10.summary: In the northeast arts district, 350 artists open their studios and offer demonstrations and workshops.

2023-11-10.name: Beacon lighting at Split Rock Lighthouse
2023-11-10.summary: This event, which commemorates the 1975 sinking of the ore freighter with 29 men, is the only time the public can see the interior of the light tower when the beacon is lighted.

2023-11-10.name: Gales of November
2023-11-10.summary: Listen to experts discuss Lake Superior shipwrecks and maritime history. There are social events, too, open to the public.

2023-11-11.name: Art Attack
2023-11-11.summary: In the northeast arts district, 350 artists open their studios and offer demonstrations and workshops.

2023-11-11.name: Gales of November
2023-11-11.summary: Listen to experts discuss Lake Superior shipwrecks and maritime history. There are social events, too, open to the public.

2023-11-11.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2023-11-11.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2023-11-11.name: Art on the Prairie
2023-11-11.summary: This free festival northwest of Des Moines showcases more than 100 Iowa artists, poets and musicians in seven venues, including the Hotel Pattee, in the downtown historic and cultural district. There will also be children's activities.

2023-11-12.name: Art Attack
2023-11-12.summary: In the northeast arts district, 350 artists open their studios and offer demonstrations and workshops.

2023-11-12.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2023-11-12.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2023-11-13.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2023-11-16.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2023-11-16.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2023-11-16.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2023-11-16.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2023-11-16.name: Winterer's Gathering
2023-11-16.summary: There's a tent encampment, winter skills seminars, Arctic film festival and chili feed at the North House Folk School.

2023-11-17.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2023-11-17.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2023-11-17.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2023-11-17.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2023-11-17.name: Winterer's Gathering
2023-11-17.summary: There's a tent encampment, winter skills seminars, Arctic film festival and chili feed at the North House Folk School.

2023-11-17.name: Christkindlmarket
2023-11-17.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2023-11-17.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2023-11-17.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2023-11-17.name: Holiday Folk Fair International
2023-11-17.summary: More than 50 ethnic groups present music, dance, food and crafts from around the world at the Wisconsin State Fair Exposition Center.

2023-11-17.name: Outdoor Adventure Expo
2023-11-17.summary: The expo at the Midwest Mountaineering store on the West Bank includes dozens of speakers and seminars about skiing, sled-dog racing and ice-climbing as well as camping, backpacking and other year-round adventures.

2023-11-17.name: Christkindlmarkt
2023-11-17.summary: This Lake Michigan town holds its Old World Christmas market in Lakehaven Hall, with a craft market, music and German food. On Friday, there's a holiday lights parade at 6:30 p.m.

2023-11-17.name: Christmas by the Bay
2023-11-17.summary: There's a car parade Friday evening, followed by tree light, caroling and horse-drawn wagon rides. On Saturday, there's a parade at 10 a.m.

2023-11-18.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2023-11-18.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2023-11-18.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2023-11-18.name: Magnificent Mile Lights Festival & Parade
2023-11-18.summary: There will be music and family activities on Michigan Avenue, with a  lighted parade from Oak Street to Wacker Drive, followed by fireworks over the Chicago River.

2023-11-23.name: Thanksgiving Parade
2023-11-23.summary: It's the 88th anniversary of the parade down State Street in the Loop. It starts at 8 a.m. at State Street and Ida B. Wells Drive and moves northward toward Randolph.

2023-11-24.name: Christkindlsmarkt
2023-11-24.summary: The open-air market in this Minneapolis suburb on Lake Minnetonka opens with a parade and includes concerts, balloon art, storytelling, reindeer, visits with the Christkind, mugs of warm Glühwein and a children's lantern parade at 4 p.m. Saturday.

2023-11-24.name: European Christmas Market
2023-11-24.summary: This Christkindlmarkt in Union Depot features choirs, dancers, hot mulled wine, holiday beers,  European-inspired food and artisan goods.

2023-11-24.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2023-11-24.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2023-11-24.name: Holidazzle
2023-11-24.summary: This free holiday market in Loring Park, on the edge of downtown, features an artisan market, appearances by Santa and the illuminated Holidazzle Yeti, outdoor yoga, choirs, a beer garden and fireworks.
